main_definition: to give or show something to someone, typically as an offering or gift; also referring to the act of being in a particular place at a specific time.

meanings_and_examples.definition: To give or offer something to someone
meanings_and_examples.example: She will present her project findings to the committee.

meanings_and_examples.definition: To be in attendance at a particular event or gathering
meanings_and_examples.example: The guest of honor is expected to present at the awards ceremony tonight.

meanings_and_examples.definition: A gift or offering given during a special occasion
meanings_and_examples.example: I brought you flowers as a present for your birthday.

meanings_and_examples.definition: To show something, usually with attention and interest; to display
meanings_and_examples.example: The teacher asked the students to present their work on climate change.

meanings_and_examples.definition: Currently existing or occurring in a particular place at a given time
meanings_and_examples.example: Present weather conditions are sunny with occasional clouds.

meanings_and_examples.definition: To hold up for examination; to show clearly and distinctly
meanings_and_examples.example: The evidence presented by the prosecutor was compelling.

meanings_and_examples.definition: A moment or period in time, such as a meeting or class session
meanings_and_examples.example: There is no need to attend the presentation at 3 PM; it will take place next Monday during our regular meeting.
